page.title: 01Bromfield & Onibury area
page.content: Much of this basin-like area between valleys of the rivers Teme(principal) & Onny,just above their confluence,is about 120m above sea level. It drains from pools,ponds,springs & streams to the river Onny generally. The A49(T) & the railway follow the Onny valley;the A4113 branches to follow the Teme valley. The populaion of only 300-400 has 2 villages,Bromfield & Onibury,3 hamlets,10 farms,a few disp- ersed houses and cottages. 2 estates each with large occupied mansion,are included & nearly half the area is in the Plymouth Estates a large diverse farming enterprise. There is intensive cultivation,yet several woods, planta- tions & substantial hedgerows exist. The arable crops are cereals, potatoes, rape & maize,& soft fruit. Considerable area is given to dairy beef and sheep.
